Looking at the board, our snake (ID 2) is now at (3,5) and the closest target remains the apple at (4,6). From our current position the Manhattan distance to (4,6) is |4–3| + |6–5| = 1 + 1 = 2.

• Alternatively, if we move UP, we’ll hit (3,6) and the distance becomes |4–3| + |6–6| = 1 + 0 = 1. That path would then require moving RIGHT the next turn.

Both options are equivalent in terms of reducing the distance by one. However, moving directly RIGHT from (3,5) puts us immediately in line with the target apple’s x-coordinate, setting up a simple upward move afterward.

There are no hazards nearby in either chosen cell, and the enemy snake (head at (8,7) and body at (8,6)) isn’t a concern for these moves.

Thus, following this reasoning, my next move from (3,5) is: RIGHT.
